channel.title: CVE Feed for MobSF -- Mobile-Security-Framework-MobSF
channel.description: The latest CVEs for MobSF -- Mobile-Security-Framework-MobSF

item.title: CVE-2024-43399|2024-08-19T15:27:04.688Z -- mobsf -- mobile-security-framework-mobsf
item.description: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis. Before 4.0.7, there is a flaw in the Static Libraries analysis section. Specifically, during the extraction of .a extension files, the measure intended to prevent Zip Slip attacks is improperly implemented. Since the implemented measure can be bypassed, the vulnerability allows an attacker to extract files to any desired location within the server running MobSF. This vulnerability is fixed in 4.0.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-31215|2024-08-02T01:46:04.599Z -- mobsf -- mobile-security-framework-mobsf
item.description: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a security research platform for mobile applications in Android, iOS and Windows Mobile. A SSRF vulnerability in firebase database check logic. The attacker can cause the server to make a connection to internal-only services within the organization’s infrastructure. When a malicious app is uploaded to Static analyzer, it is possible to make internal requests. This vulnerability has been patched in version 3.9.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-41955|2024-08-01T13:40:36.551Z -- mobsf -- mobile-security-framework-mobsf
item.description: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a security research platform for mobile applications in Android, iOS and Windows Mobile. An open redirect vulnerability exist in MobSF authentication view. Update to MobSF v4.0.5.

item.title: CVE-2024-29190|2024-07-18T13:58:13.002Z -- mobsf -- mobile-security-framework-mobsf
item.description: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis. In version 3.9.5 Beta and prior, MobSF does not perform any input validation when extracting the hostnames in `android:host`, so requests can also be sent to local hostnames. This can lead to server-side request forgery. An attacker can cause the server to make a connection to internal-only services within the organization's infrastructure. Commit 5a8eeee73c5f504a6c3abdf2a139a13804efdb77 has a hotfix for this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-43399|2024-08-19T14:44:47.180Z -- mobsf -- mobile-security-framework-mobsf
item.description: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis.
